definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
variant of 正經八百|正经八百[zheng4 jing1 ba1 bai3]
see 正經八百|正经八百[zheng4 jing1 ba1 bai3]

sentences.english: The only thing one can write that is a bit serious—a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 唯一我们能够写的就是一板正经的情书。

sentences.english: This grave matron had several sorts of practice.
sentences.chinese: 这位假正经的妇人有好几种惯做的事情。

sentences.english: Are you seriously suggesting she did this on purpose?
sentences.chinese: 说正经的，你的意思是她故意这样做的？

sentences.english: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.chinese: 她们矫揉造作，一本正经还撅着嘴。
说正经事吧，不然我就走了。

sentences.english: It is anything but easy to remould a lady of easy virtue.
sentences.chinese: 要改造一个不正经的女人，并非易事。

sentences.english: The Rattlers viewed the Eagles as goody-goody kids.
sentences.chinese: 响尾蛇队则认为老鹰队装正经。

sentences.english: John wanted to talk turkey , but Jane just wanted to joke around.
sentences.chinese: 约翰想谈正经事，而简只想闹着玩。

sentences.english: "What is your fee, Koriba?" she asked, suddenly businesslike.
sentences.chinese: “这怎么收费，柯利巴？”她突然一本正经的问道。

sentences.english: He had his hat tucked under one arm and wore a grim scowl on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他一只胳膊上放着帽子，一脸正经的。

sentences.english: Mr Bush has serious business to do at each stop (see article).
sentences.chinese: 布什总统经停的每一站都有正经事要做。

sentences.english: But beneath the surface, your brain is often hard at work on big picture problems.
sentences.chinese: 但是在表面下，你的大脑却难以在正经问题上运转。

sentences.english: Roy:And seriously, what's with the hat, man? Geez.
sentences.chinese: 说正经的，伙计，那帽子是干嘛的？哈。

sentences.english: He always plays fast and loose with his work.
sentences.chinese: 他对工作总是敷衍了事，不正经干。

sentences.english: But suddenly think of a peony will not serious book on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 月满突然想起牡丹将一本不正经的书放在枕头底。

sentences.english: 31 a person or serious, even the headache are offset.
sentences.chinese: 一个人要不正经，连头疼都是偏的。

definition: to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
